questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: (anchor) tag is used to create hyperlinks: text

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

questions.question: Who is making the Web standards?
questions.explanation: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) is the main international standards organization for the World Wide Web.

questions.question: Choose the correct HTML element for the largest heading:
questions.explanation: <h1> defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML element for inserting a line break?
questions.explanation:
The
tag inserts a single line break.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for adding a background color?
questions.explanation: The 'style' attribute with the 'background-color' property is the modern way to set background colors.

questions.question: Choose the correct HTML element to define important text:
questions.explanation: The <strong> element is used to identify text of great importance.

questions.question: Choose the correct HTML element to define emphasized text:
questions.explanation: The <em> element is used to define emphasized text.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> (anchor) tag with the 'href' attribute is used to create hyperlinks.

questions.question: What does the 'flex-direction' property do in Flexbox?
options: Sets the direction of the flex items
Sets the size of the flex items
questions.explanation: flex-direction defines the direction the container wants to stack the flex items (row, column, etc.).

questions.question: Which property is used to align flex items along the main axis?
questions.explanation: justify-content aligns items along the main axis (horizontal by default).

questions.question: Which property is used to align flex items along the cross axis?
questions.explanation: align-items defines the default behavior for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis.

questions.question: What does 'display: grid;' do?
questions.explanation: CSS Grid Layout is a 2-dimensional system, meaning it can handle both columns and rows.

questions.question: Which property defines the number of columns in a CSS Grid?
questions.explanation: grid-template-columns defines the line names and track sizing functions of the grid columns.

questions.question: What is the 'fr' unit in CSS Grid?
questions.explanation: The fr unit allows you to set the size of a track as a fraction of the free space of the grid container.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to add space between grid cells?
questions.explanation: The 'gap' property (previously grid-gap) sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <main> tag?
options: Specifies the dominant content of the <body>
questions.explanation: The <main> tag contains the central topic or functionality of a document.

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used for standalone content like blog posts or news stories?
questions.explanation: <article> is intended to be independently distributable or reusable.

questions.question: What does the 'z-index' property do?
options: Sets the stack order of positioned elements
questions.explanation: z-index specifies the stack order of an element (which element should be in front).

questions.question: Which property is used to create a transition effect?
questions.explanation: The transition property allows you to change property values smoothly over a given duration.

questions.question: What does 'transform: rotate(45deg);' do?
questions.explanation: The rotate() function defines a transformation that rotates an element around a fixed point.

questions.question: How do you make an element invisible but still keep its space?
questions.explanation: visibility: hidden and opacity: 0 both hide the element while it still occupies its space in the layout.

questions.question: Which property sets the space between the content and the border?
questions.explanation: Padding is the space inside the border, while margin is outside.

questions.question: What does 'box-sizing: border-box;' do?
options: Adds a border to the box
Includes padding and border in the element's total width and height
questions.explanation: border-box ensures that the specified width includes padding and border, preventing layout issues.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to make text italic?
questions.explanation: font-style: italic; is used to set the font style to italic.

questions.question: How do you select only the first child of an element?
questions.explanation: The :first-child pseudo-class matches an element that is the first child of its parent.

questions.question: What is a 'Media Query' used for?
options: Applying styles based on device characteristics like screen width
questions.explanation: Media queries are the basis for responsive web design, allowing different styles for different devices.

questions.question: What does '@keyframes' define?
options: A key that opens a lock
questions.explanation: The @keyframes rule specifies the animation code.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the mouse cursor?
questions.explanation: The cursor property specifies the mouse cursor to be displayed when pointing over an element.

questions.question: What is the default value of the 'position' property?
questions.explanation: By default, elements are positioned 'static', meaning they follow the normal document flow.

questions.question: Which position value keeps an element in the same place even when scrolling?
questions.explanation: fixed positioning is relative to the viewport, meaning it stays in place during scroll.

questions.question: What is 'rem' unit relative to?
questions.explanation: rem stands for 'root em', which is relative to the font-size of the <html> element.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <nav> element?
questions.explanation: The <nav> element is intended for major blocks of navigation links.

questions.question: How do you center an element horizontally using margins?
questions.explanation: Setting margin-left and margin-right to auto centers a block element within its container.

questions.question: Which property is used to set the order of flex items?
questions.explanation: The 'order' property specifies the order of a flex item relative to the rest of the flex items.

questions.question: What does 'vh' stand for?
questions.explanation: 1vh is equal to 1% of the viewport's height.

questions.question: Which attribute is used with <source> inside <picture>?
questions.explanation: srcset is used to specify multiple image resources for different scenarios.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'alt' attribute in ?
options: Alternative text if image fails to load
questions.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative information for an image if a user cannot view it.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to specify whether the content of an element should be clipped?
questions.explanation: The overflow property specifies what should happen if content overflows an element's box.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to draw graphics, on the fly, via scripting (usually JavaScript)?
questions.explanation: The <canvas> element is used to draw graphics on a web page via JavaScript.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to specify a secondary content that is related to the main content?
questions.explanation: The <aside> element defines some content aside from the content it is placed in (like a sidebar).

questions.question: What does SVG stand for?
questions.explanation: SVG stands for Scalable Vector Graphics, used for defining vector-based graphics for the Web.

questions.question: Which CSS property specifies the transparency of an element?
questions.explanation: The opacity property sets the opacity level for an element (0.0 to 1.0).

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'viewport' meta tag?
options: Controls how a webpage is displayed on a mobile device
questions.explanation: The viewport meta tag gives the browser instructions on how to control the page's dimensions and scaling.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to specify the stack order of an element?
questions.explanation: z-index specifies the stack order of an element (which element should be in front).

questions.question: What does the 'inherit' value do in CSS?
options: Specifies that a property should inherit its value from its parent element
questions.explanation: The inherit keyword specifies that a property should inherit its value from its parent element.

questions.question: Which property defines what happens if content overflows an element's box?
questions.explanation: The overflow property specifies whether to clip content or add scrollbars when an element's content is too big.

questions.question: What is the 'flex-wrap' property used for?
options: Specifying whether flex items should wrap or not
questions.explanation: flex-wrap specifies whether the flex items should wrap or not if there is not enough room on the axis.

questions.question: Which property is used to set the spacing between lines of text?
questions.explanation: The line-height property is used to specify the space between lines.

questions.question: What does 'pointer-events: none;' do?
options: Makes an element non-reactive to mouse events
Changes the cursor to a pointer
questions.explanation: pointer-events: none; makes the element 'transparent' to mouse clicks and hover events.

questions.question: Which property is used to create a shadow effect around an element?
questions.explanation: box-shadow attaches one or more shadows to an element.

questions.question: What is a 'Pseudo-element' in CSS?
options: A keyword added to a selector that lets you style a specific part of the selected element(s)
questions.explanation: Pseudo-elements like ::before and ::after allow styling specific parts of an element.

questions.question: Which property specifies the alignment of the last line of a text?
questions.explanation: text-align-last specifies how to align the last line of a text.

questions.question: What does 'content: "";' usually accompany in CSS?
questions.explanation: The content property is used with the ::before and ::after pseudo-elements to insert generated content.

questions.question: Which CSS unit is relative to the width of the viewport?
questions.explanation: 1vw is equal to 1% of the viewport width.

questions.question: How do you make a list that lists its items with circle bullets?
questions.explanation: list-style-type: circle; sets the marker to an open circle.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a list of pre-defined options for an <input> element?
questions.explanation: The <datalist> tag specifies a list of pre-defined options for an <input> element.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <figure> element?
options: Specifying self-contained content, like illustrations or photos
questions.explanation: The <figure> element specifies self-contained content, like illustrations, diagrams, photos, code listings, etc.

questions.question: Which property is used to set the background image of an element?
questions.explanation: The background-image property sets one or more background images for an element.

questions.question: Which character is used to indicate an end tag?
questions.explanation: End tags are identical to start tags but with a forward slash / before the tag name.

questions.question: How can you make a numbered list?
questions.explanation: <ol> stands for Ordered List, which displays items with numbers.

questions.question: How can you make a bulleted list?
questions.explanation: <ul> stands for Unordered List, which displays items with bullets.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for making a checkbox?
questions.explanation: <input type='checkbox'> defines a checkbox.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for making a text input field?
questions.explanation: <input type='text'> defines a single-line text input field.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
questions.explanation: The <footer> element defines a footer for a document or section.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

questions.question: Which HTML attribute is used to define inline styles?
questions.explanation: The style attribute is used to add inline styles to an element.

questions.question: Which is the correct CSS syntax?
questions.explanation: CSS rules consist of a selector and a declaration block: selector {property: value;}.

questions.question: How do you insert a comment in a CSS file?
questions.explanation: /* */ is used to wrap comments in CSS.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the background color?
questions.explanation: background-color sets the background color of an element.

questions.question: How do you add a background color for all <h1> elements?
questions.explanation: Selecting 'h1' as the element selector applies styles to all h1 tags.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property specifies the text color of an element.

questions.question: Which CSS property controls the text size?
questions.explanation: The 'font-size' property sets the size of the font.

What is the correct CSS syntax for making all the

elements bold?
questions.explanation: font-weight: bold; is used to set the weight (thickness) of the font.

questions.question: How do you display hyperlinks without an underline?
questions.explanation: text-decoration: none; removes the default underline from links.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the font of an element?
questions.explanation: The font-family property specifies the font for an element.

questions.question: How do you make the text bold?
questions.explanation: font-weight: bold; makes the text bold.

questions.question: How do you make a list that lists its items with squares?
questions.explanation: list-style-type: square; changes the bullet style to squares.

questions.question: How do you select an element with id 'demo'?
questions.explanation: # selects an element by its ID.

questions.question: How do you select elements with a specific class?
questions.explanation: . selects elements by their class name.

questions.question: How do you select all p elements inside a div element?
questions.explanation: A descendant selector (space) matches all elements that are descendants of a specified element.

questions.question: Which CSS property changes text color?
questions.explanation: color property sets the color of text.

questions.question: What is the largest heading tag?
questions.explanation: <h1> is the largest heading, <h6> is smallest.

questions.question: Which CSS property makes text bold?
questions.explanation: font-weight property makes text bold: font-weight: bold

questions.question: How to link external CSS file?
questions.explanation: <link rel='stylesheet' href='style.css'> links external CSS file.

questions.question: Which attribute provides alternate text for images?
questions.explanation: alt attribute provides alternative text when image can't be displayed.

questions.question: What does CSS box model consist of?
questions.explanation: Box model: content (innermost), padding, border, margin (outermost).

questions.question: Which tag creates a line break?
questions.explanation: tag creates a line break (new line).

questions.question: What is the purpose of CSS margin?
questions.explanation: margin creates space outside element's border.

questions.question: Which tag is used for unordered list?
questions.explanation: <ul> creates unordered (bulleted) list.

questions.question: What does CSS position: absolute do?
options: Positioned relative to nearest positioned ancestor
questions.explanation: position: absolute positions element relative to nearest positioned ancestor.

questions.question: Which CSS property centers text?
questions.explanation: text-align: center centers text horizontally.

questions.question: What is a div tag?
questions.explanation: <div> is block-level container used for layout.

questions.question: Which property changes background color?
questions.explanation: background-color property sets background color: background-color: red

questions.question: What does CSS z-index do?
questions.explanation: z-index controls stacking order of positioned elements.

questions.question: Which tag creates a paragraph?
questions.explanation: tag creates a paragraph.

questions.question: What is the difference between class and id?
options: id is unique, class can be reused
questions.explanation: id is unique identifier, class can be used multiple times.

questions.question: Which CSS property makes element display inline?
questions.explanation: display: inline makes element inline (takes only needed width).

questions.question: What does CSS float do?
questions.explanation: float positions element to left or right of container.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
questions.explanation: The <footer> element typically contains information about its containing element, such as authorship, copyright, etc.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for adding a background color?
questions.explanation: The style attribute is used to apply inline CSS for background-color.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define important text?

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for making a text input field?

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a multi-line input field?
questions.explanation: The <textarea> tag defines a multi-line text input control.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the font of an element?
questions.explanation: font-family specifies the font for an element.

questions.question: How do you display a border like this: The top border = 10px, bottom border = 5px, left border = 20px, right border = 1px?
questions.explanation: The order of border-width values is: top, right, bottom, left.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the left margin of an element?
questions.explanation: margin-left sets the left margin of an element.

questions.question: How do you make the text bold in CSS?
questions.explanation: font-weight:bold; is used to make text bold.

questions.explanation: list-style-type specifies the type of list-item marker.
